If you have a health problem, you want a doctor to use research – not just an opinion – to treat it. The same kind of approach should be used to tackle the public health epidemic of gun violence.

The Board, which will be housed at @HHSGov in recognition that gun violence is a public health epidemic, will be responsible for conducting research, evaluating federal and state policy proposals, and recommending best practices for reducing gun violence.

Today, I announced the Gun Safety Board & Research Act to enable the development of evidence-based solutions to gun violence. https://desaulnier.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/congressman-desaulnier-introduces-bill-develop-evidence-based-solutions …

The #SafeLandings Act takes proactive steps to improve aviation safety and save lives. 
 https://www.facebook.com/RepMarkDeSaulnier/videos/464729694080829/ …

#HappeningNow, @CaptSully and I are live from a press conference at SFO to unveil legislation that responds to the rise in the number of close calls happening around the country—including the Air Canada near-miss that put over 1k lives in jeopardy right here in the Bay Area.

Soon @CaptSully and I will unveil legislation that provides sweeping safety improvements to our aviation system—from on the ground, in the cockpit, and at the control tower. Tune in live here at 12:00 p.m.
Our aviation system is the safest in the world, but when a close call happens we must investigate, learn all we can, and respond.
If you can’t make it, the meeting will be streamed live on our social media channels by @ContraCostaTV.

Our priority first and foremost needs to be making sure American families do not have to live through another tragedy.

Mass shooting events are a uniquely American problem in need of an immediate solution. That’s why I support common sense reforms like universal background checks on gun sales, banning assault weapons, and mandatory reporting of lost or stolen weapons. https://nyti.ms/31lcTIT

There should be no place in the American political system for a President who espouses racist rhetoric, for elected officials who refuse to recognize or condemn hatred and white nationalism, and for campaign contributions from the gun lobby to hold more weight than human life.

We’re grieving for El Paso & Dayton. My heart’s broken for the families that lost a loved one; for the children who witnessed evil firsthand & for our nation that finds itself w/ leaders who condone racism & allow the gun lobby to have a stronghold over their moral consciousness. https://twitter.com/CNN/status/1158032355958972417 …
Today is the 180th day of the year & America has witnessed 250 mass shootings already in that time. When will enough be enough? #EnoughIsEnough
